oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effets Du Blocage Des Recepteurs Serotonergiques De Type 2 Sur Les Modifications Fonctionnelles Respiratoires Induites Par Un Challenge A La Serotonine Chez Le Bovin
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Linden, A.
Desmecht, D.
Amory, H.
Rollin, F.
Lekeux, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: 5-hydroxytryptamine
pulmonary function
hyperventilation
diffuse bronchoconstriction
pulmonary artery hypertension
in vivo
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effects of exogenous 5-hydroxytryptamine (5-HT) on pulmonary bovine function i.e. , hyperventilation, diffuse bronchoconstriction and pulmonary artery hypertension, have been previously reported. The purpose of the present investigation was to study, in vivo, the effects of a 5-HT challenge preceeded by treatment with a selective blocking agent of 5-HT2 receptors (R 50970) on pulmonary bovine function. Article in French, English and German summaries on PDF
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1992: Volume 3; 405-410
